data.text: A Cook System for Long Distance and Lightweight Bike Tours

Hey all, trying to find the perfect cook system for long distance but lightweight tours (cooking for 2). I'm being a greedy bugger and would like to be able to use alcohol, gas and potentially wood/twigs. I also cook a lot so want something with decent usability. Options shrinking already, I know! I've recently been using the Firebox Nano which is ace for twigs and alcohol. It's meant to be usable with a gas burner (the Trangia style ones) but it's a nightmare to setup properly. Have a full Trangia cook set, which is the best in terms of functionality but is pretty big and heavy, also no possibility for burning solids. Also have a Trangia Triangle which is ace for gas and alcohol but needs a separate windshield and no twig burning potential. Anyone found anything that ticks all those boxes? Also up for little hacks to adapt cool systems to different uses. Thanks!
Pocket rocket mark two, fast light weight

data.text: You could just use your trangia and totally just make a little support out of larger bits of wood or stone and then burn all the twigs you want. I have used my trangia pans on open fire. Makes the pans hard to clean underneath, but totally do and.. not light or small of course, but you already own it and it's dead versatile. I toured with the gas burn version and just dealt with the size/weight because I could eat real food at the end of the day.. people made jokes about my set up, but they shut up when I was eating pancakes at breakfast time...
